title: Baylor vs Houston live stream: how to watch March Madness 2021 from anywhere
author: aatif-sulleyman
summary: An all-Texas affair that ends decades-long Final Four droughts
article: The first of this season's March Madness Final Four games sees overall No. 2 seed Baylor take on overall No. 8 seed Houston in an all-Texas affair. This is the first time the Bears have made the National Semifinals since 1950, while the Cougars haven't got this far since 1984 - and they haven't played against each other in nearly 20 years! Read on as we explain how to get a Baylor vs Houston live stream and watch March Madness from anywhere in the world.

The South Regional champions have won all but one of their four March Madness games by double-digits and have the best 3-point shooting percentage in the country (41.1%), but guard Davion Mitchell has been their main man, steering them past Villanova and Arkansas.

Perhaps harshly, the Coogs still have a point to prove, having only faced double-digit seeds so far. They’ve been excellent at neutralizing their opponents' top scorers, and in Quentin Grimes, who's averaging 18 points per game, they have a serious weapon of their own.

But many neutrals are praying for a national championship showdown between the Bears and the Zags, who face UCLA in the other Final Four match-up. Follow our guide below to tune into a March Madness live stream and watch Baylor vs Houston online from anywhere - including some great ways to watch March Madness free online in certain countries, if you draw up the right play.

If you're currently abroad or there's no official broadcast option in your country, then you’ll need to use a VPN to dial in to a location that does let you watch March Madness online in the same way you would at home.

A VPN is perfect for this, as it allows you to change your IP address so you appear to be in your country of residence, where you usual streaming services and subscriptions are based. You may be surprised by how easy it easy to get started using one, too.

In some countries, you may be baffled by the fact that NCAA college basketball is just as popular as the NBA among some fans. If you want to know what all the fuss is about or are just a US expat living abroad that's desperate to root for their school, then ESPN Player is the way to watch a March Madness live stream in many countries around the world.
It's available in the UK, Europe, the Middle East and Africa, coming in at the very reasonable price of £9.99/€11.99 for the next month (or £69.99/€79.99 for a whole year).

That gets you live and on-demand coverage of every single March Madness 2021 game, as well as access to other live sports events, ESPN originals and ESPN Films. The service also supports both desktop and mobile, so you’ll never miss any of the action, no matter where you.

Best of all, anyone in one of the service's covered countries can try a FREE 7-day ESPN Player trial to see if they like it or not - one of the few legitimate ways to watch NCAA March Madness free online this month.
